message: Using mutable data structures for teaching purposes is usually discouraged. Replace Hashtables by standart tree-like maps or consider Hash-Array Mapped Tries (HAMT). Use mutable `ref`erences and mutable structure fields only if it is really required. In all places where it is needed indeed, describe in a comment why it is needed there.

Performance issue. It's recommended to rewrite
	'List.map f (List.map g xs)'
as
	'List.map (fun y -> f (g y)) xs'
